children.value: is used to setup a Realm Database that can be synchronized between devices using MongoDB Realm.
for more information on how to get a user object.
Synchronized Realms only support additive migrations which can be detected and performed automatically, so the following builder options are not accessible compared to a normal Realm:

appropriate to open a read-only, non-synced Realm to recover any pending changes. This is useful when trying to open a backup/recovery Realm (after a client reset).

appropriate to open a read-only, non-synced Realm to recover any pending changes. This is useful when trying to open a backup/recovery Realm (after a client reset). Note: This will use the default Realm module (composed of all
), and assume no encryption should be used as well.
the absolute path to the Realm file defined by this configuration.

NOTE: Only for internal usage. May change without warning. Returns the stop policy for the session for this Realm once the Realm has been closed.
Returns the url prefix used when establishing a sync connection to the Realm Object Server.
Returns the value this Realm is partitioned on. The partition key is a property defined in MongoDB Realm. All classes with a property with this value will be synchronized to the Realm.
